alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 01 at 2:29PM CST until January 01 at 2:45PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN LAFAYETTE AND SOUTHWESTERN MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 228 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Harmontown, or 7 miles northwest of Holly Springs National Forest, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Harmontown, Burgess, Laws Hill, Abbeville, Malone, College Hill Station, Blackwater, College Hill, Teckville and Spraggins. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
